Job Description:
If you are motivated to succeed and can see yourself in this role, please complete our application. We will follow up with you on the next steps in the interview process.

Our associates are a strategic advantage for us who are making a difference at Littelfuse. Join our team and make a difference every day!

Currently we are looking for IT Project Manager reporting to the Global Head of IT PMO who will be responsible for supporting the IT-PMO and its day-today activities within this department to ensure programs and projects meet organization goals and requirements. Implements and provides guidance related to PMO processes and policies, oversees the work of project management for the Europe region, works with the IT leaders to define, prioritize and develop projects and programs (primarily in the Europe region but cross-over to other regions as needed).

About the job:
Support global head of IT PMO in developing and defining best practices, processes, project management tools, and PMO templates.
Provide project management support and guidance to the IT organization.
Maintain a quality lens on the project management, requirements, documentation/analysis, and testing processes.
Provide organizational change management support as projects are implemented.
Continue to re-assess opportunities for project management process improvements.
Support IT department’s project portfolio management
Maintain a high level of customer satisfaction with our internal business units.
Develops strong relationships with internal clients, IT management, IT technical staff and peers to define project goals, timelines and identifying and deploying resources to meet target completion dates.
Develop and maintain positive & effective relationships with the organization and Engage stakeholders across the organization to deliver results.
About you:
Bachelor’s Degree required
Must possess minimum 3 years of project management experience with strong knowledge and expertise in program/project management/systems development methodologies such as Agile, Waterfall, Six Sigma, and of SDLC, iterative and related methodologies.
Experience in manufacturing and SAP.
Prior experience working in a global environment.
Ability to pull a diverse group of stakeholders with different goals together and facilitate productive discussions.
Ability to work well within an environment of frequently changing priorities, adapt as needed, and develop a solution-oriented approach.
Ability to communicate professionally & effectively to both technical and business teams, across all levels of the organization. Excellent presentation skills & comfort around senior leadership.
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work cross-functionally with a variety of stakeholders and develop a solution-oriented approach.
Commitment to company values.
We offer:
The opportunity to work in an international company with dynamic environment and develop professionally by expanding your knowledge though cross-functional, cross-cultural collaboration
Opportunity to work part time from home office
Full-time position with start date asap

Job Title: Junior Operations Officer (Night Shift, Part-Time position)
Job Description:
Currently, we are looking for a highly motivated and dedicated person who is willing to learn and be a part of our Foreign Exchange and Money Market team. As a Junior Operations Officer, you will be responsible for mainly computer-related back-office tasks of simple-to-medium complexity, with some client-facing tasks. Your job includes various back-office services, such as data entry, data validation and customer support as you will be in contact with stakeholders from various countries – India, USA, Nordic countries etc.

As a Junior Operations Officer, you will be working in a team of about 17 employees. You will be cooperating with 2 other colleagues in the night shift between 11 p.m. and 4 a.m. on workdays (Monday-Friday).
In the first month we expect you to be able to come to the office during standard working hours for training purposes. After that, your will be working during night shift hours.
*Your official title will be Officer – Service Delivery, Associate.
Mission:

Monitoring Foreign Exchange (FX) / Continuous Linked Settlement (CLS) transactions
Monitoring and approving trades, ensuring successful matching
Regular communication with different stakeholders within the bank as well as external parties via phone and email
Investigation, analysis and problem solving
Maintaining and improving quality in daily tasks, so that the client receives the best possible service
Skills:
Ability to work during night is a must
Interest or experience in FX, money markets, finance and economics
Fluent English both in speaking and writing
Excellent analytical skills and high level of accuracy and attention to details
Ability to process large volumes of tasks and data
Customer focus, ability to learn quickly
Ability to prioritize effectively, make decisions independently in a fast-changing environment without compromising quality
We will ensure that exact salary offered for you will be based on your qualifications, competencies, professional experience and requirements for the corresponding job function (salary range from 900 EUR to 1400 EUR gross EUR/monthly).

We care about your well-being and work-life balance, so we offer a whole package of benefits for you in addition! Check this out.

If you have any questions feel free to reach out to Evaldas Salkauskas, Hiring Manager on +370 673 84370

Send application and CV no later than 27.04.2020.

Job Title: Work from Home | Social Media Evaluator
Job Description:
If you love social media and are an active user, now is the time to get paid for your time on social media platforms! Social Media Evaluators with Appen evaluate the quality and relevance of information in their local area or country of residence in categories such as news feeds, advertisements and search results. Tech companies around the world need the knowledge and experience of the very people who use their services. Social Media Evaluators have a direct impact on the effectiveness and relevancy of the service these companies provide.
The Social Media Evaluator is a work-from-home opportunity where all you need is a computer or smartphone and the desire to make a positive impact while working in the social media platforms you enjoy.
These are entry-level positions and Social Media Evaluators can learn new technologies and receive income just by having the experience of participating in social media.
Don’t miss this opportunity to be part of a Appen’s rapidly growing global Social Media Evaluation services providing critical data for the world’s top internet search engine companies!
Work Schedule:
· Social Media Evaluator positions are flexible, part-time and only require between 1 and 4 hours a day with your choice of 5 to 7 days a week up to 20 hours a week!
Requirements:
· Must be currently residing in and able to perform work tasks in Lithuanian
· Access to a computer or smart phone that is less than 3 years old
· High-speed internet connection
· Ability to read and write in English to understand and perform work tasks to customer specifications
Characteristics for Success:
· Ability and desire to work from home doing internet-based work within social media platforms
· Active user on social media platforms such as Facebook and Instagram
· Good English spelling skills
· Basic level of computer and/or smart phone operational knowledge
· Ability and willingness to comprehend and follow instructions independently
· Experience as a freelancer or other work-from-home opportunities
Compensation:
· Dependent upon project
Click HERE to watch a short video to learn more about Social Media Evaluation.
Appen Rewards and Recognition:
FlexJobs – Recognized by FlexJobs as a Top 100 Company to Watch for Remote Jobs in 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017 including the #1 Ranking in 2017!
Deloitte Technology Fast 50 – Three-time winner in the Deloitte Technology Fast 50 Australia Awards from 2012 through 2014.
Momentum Mid-Market Awards – Finalist in the BRW Momentum Awards for Best Mid-Market Business $50-$100MM Category. In addition, Appen was a finalist in the 2014 Australian Growth Technology Company Awards.
Australian Export Rewards – Inaugural winner in 2008 of the Prime Minister’s Exporter of the Year Award and Australian Export Category winner, Information and Communication Technology Award.
Appen’s clients are the top technology companies in the world. We are a global technology and language consulting firm, operating in 180 languages and we staff projects ranging in size from under one hundred to thousands of remote workers around the globe. Appen’s work provides the critical data our clients need to improve the technology experience in many platforms for all users.
Note: Appen is actively hiring for many clients. We have other opportunities which may be contractor or employee status, or have different schedules and requirements. Our team will evaluate your application and review all positions that might be a quality fit based on your skills and experience. To see all our work opportunities, please visit join.appen.com.
